result.notes:
Percentage of households for whom a decision on whether their application for assistance under the homeless provisions of housing legislation has been made
Source: Communities and Local Government (CLG): ID 2007
Publisher: Neighbourhood Statistics
Geographies: Local Authority District (LAD)
Geographic coverage: England
Time coverage: 2007
Type of data: Administrative data (some modelling)
Notes: Part of Wider Barriers Subdomain

organization.name: office-for-national-statistics
organization.title: Office for National Statistics
organization.description:
The Office for National Statistics (ONS) is the UK’s largest independent producer of official statistics and is the recognised national statistical institute for the UK. It is responsible for collecting and publishing statistics related to the economy, population and society at national, regional and local levels. It also conducts the census in England and Wales every ten years. 

The ONS plays a leading role in national and international good practice in the production of official statistics. It is the executive office of the UK Statistics Authority and although they are separate, they are still closely related.

result.precision: Data for the following Local Authorities was supplied by CLG as 'estimated': Barnet, Birmingham, Bolsover, Brent, Bury, Castle Point, Chesterfield, Coventry, Dudley, Fylde, Gateshead, Hackney, Halton, Hart, Havering, Hinckley and Bosworth, Islington, Kingston upon Thames, Lichfield, Mid Bedfordshire, Oldham, Poole, Richmondshire, Rugby, South Somerset, Tamworth, Thanet, Wakefield, Warwick, Winchester, Wokingham.
